availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James L Dallum (Paducah Commercial Bank Cashier)

body.p: Born on September 8, 1809 in Christian County, Kentucky. In 1833, Dallam was elected the Clerk of Court in Smithland, Livingston County, Kentucky in 1840. In 1852 he was appointed Cashier in the Commercial Bank of Kentucky at Paducah, McCracken County, Kentucky, where he remained until his death on February 18, 1879.

bibl.p: J. Smith Homans, Ed., The Bankers’ Magazine and Statistical Register (New York: J. Smith Homans, 1853), 479; Find A Grave, "James L. Dallam (September 8, 1809 - February 18, 1879)," Memorial #83941344, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=83941344&ref=acom (accessed June 27, 2017).; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Livingston County, Smithland, p. 128; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, District 2 City of Paducah, p. 122; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, City of Paducah, Subdivision 112, p. 8; “Dallam Family Public Servants,” Western Kentucky Genealogy Blog, Accessed December 27, 2016, http://wkygenealogy.blogspot.com/2009/03/dallam-family-public-servants.html
